To organize a round-robin tournament with 29 people playing 3-on-3 basketball, you will need to create a schedule that allows each team to play every other team once.

One way to do this would be to divide the 29 players into 9 teams of 3 players each. Then, you can create a schedule that has each team playing every other team once. This will result in a total of 36 games (since each team plays 8 other teams once).

To create the schedule, you can use a spreadsheet or a piece of paper to make a table with the team names down the left side and the dates or times across the top. Then, fill in the table with the match-ups for each game.

For example, if you have the following teams:

Team 1
Team 2
Team 3
Team 4
Team 5
Team 6
Team 7
Team 8
Team 9

Your schedule might look something like this:

| Date/Time | Team 1 | Team 2 | Team 3 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1/1 10am |  |  |  |
| 1/1 11am |  |  |  |
| 1/1 12pm |  |  |  |
| 1/2 10am |  |  |  |
| 1/2 11am |  |  |  |
| 1/2 12pm |  |  |  |

You would then fill in the match-ups for each time slot, making sure that each team plays every other team once.
